message.content:
cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.DS, cs.AR. 

The paper discusses an extension of a model checker to support the verification of multi-threaded software with shared variables and locks using bounded model checking (BMC) based on Satisfiability Modulo Theories (SMT). This falls under the category of software engineering (cs.SE) as it deals with the verification of software. Additionally, the paper discusses the modelling of synchronization primitives, which could fall under programming languages (cs.PL). The use of partial-order reduction (POR) techniques also suggests a connection to logic in computer science (cs.LO) and distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DS). Finally, the use of BMC and SMT solvers could also suggest a connection to computer architecture (cs.AR).
